fullText: Sorkin has crafted a theatrical experience that honors Lee's beloved novel while making it urgently relevant to our times, enhanced by a towering performance from Jeff Daniels as Atticus Finch.
dtliExcerpt: Sorkin has crafted a theatrical experience that honors Lee's beloved novel while making it urgently relevant to our times, enhanced by a towering performance from Jeff Daniels as Atticus Finch.
bwwExcerpt: Perhaps the most notable achievement of this thoughtful adaptation, and Bartlett Sher's meticulously calibrated Broadway production, is that it takes Harper Lee's 1960 novel - a modern American classic that pretty much all of us know either from studying it in high school or watching the outstanding 1962 film version - and makes us hang on every word as if experiencing the story for the first time.
showScoreExcerpt: Sorkin has crafted a theatrical experience that honors Lee's beloved novel while making it urgently relevant to our times, enhanced by a towering performance from Jeff Daniels as Atticus Finch.
